.ini to dictÂ¶

If one ever desired turning a .ini file into a python dictionary (perhaps to run functional tests on a pyramid application) it’s as easy as this!

def ini_to_dict(ini_path, sections=[]):
    """ convert ini options into dict """
    config = configparser.ConfigParser()
    config.read(ini_path)

    settings = defaultdict(lambda x: dict())
    for section in config.sections():
        if section in sections:
            for option in config.options(section):
                settings[option] = config.get(section, option)

    return settings

If you’re using a pyramid application and are doing this then the usage would look something like this:

global_config = {
        "__file__": "path/to/.ini",
        "here": "location/of/application",
        }
settings = ini_to_dict("path/to/.ini", sections=["app:main_app"])
app = app_config.main(global_config, **settings)
